6a2a78c.description: Load this script to generate an SMB command log, smb_cmd.log. This is primarily useful for debugging.

c978807.description: Log information about certificates while attempting to avoid duplicate logging.

3a50886.description: This script adds authoritative and additional responses for the current query to the DNS log. It can cause severe overhead due to the need for all authoritative and additional responses to have events generated.

ed26c25.description: Adds additional labels to dns log

ddda379.description: Add a field that logs the order of hosts sending messages using the same DHCP transaction ID. This information is occasionally needed on some networks to fully explain the DHCP sequence.

a925e33.description: Adds circuit identifier which typically represents the router or switch interface number.

740bf81.description: Extract and include the header names used for each request in the HTTP logging stream. The headers in the logging stream will be stored in the same order which they were seen on the wire.

d903a55.description: Extracts and logs variables from the requested URI in the default HTTP logging stream.

e2aeebe.description: Extracts and logs variable names from cookies sent by clients.

cd749ac.description: This script is for optionally adding a body excerpt to the SMTP entities log.

e4a5fef.description: Perform MD5 and SHA1 hashing on all files.

5ffd187.description: Calculates the information density of the contents of the file, expressed as a number of bits per character.

782a147.description: Script for tracking known Modbus masters and slaves.

e38d1ba.description: This script tracks the memory map of holding (read/write) registers and logs changes as they are discovered.

7093e8e.description: Loading this script will cause all logs to be written out as JSON by default.

924eab7.description: This script logs evidence regarding the degree to which the packet capture process suffers from measurement loss.

2878963.description: When this script is loaded, only the host certificates (client and server) will be logged to x509.log.

3e224d4.description: This script is used to extract host certificates seen on the wire to disk after being converted to PEM files. The certificates will be stored in a single file, one for local certificates and one for remote certificates.

a21ae7b.description: Add Kerberos ticket hashes to the kerberos log.

d154f23.description: Finds connections with protocols on non-standard ports with DPD.

80fbab7.description: Community Id allows for correlation across Suricata generated logs. If enabled, community_id will be added to connections and relevant protocol logs.

d3b8337.description: This script enables logging of packet segment data when a protocol parsing violation is encountered.

a3003e5.description: This script adds link-layer address (MAC) information to the connection logs

c880156.description: Adds the orientation field to the connection log. Orientation is merely a way to describe the hosts/networks involved in the communication, and how it was initiated.

ce8bc6e.description: This script calculates and adds PCR to the connection log using application bytes.

e17c61d.description: Detect various potentially bad FTP activities.

98e4cdb.description: Software identification and extraction for FTP protocol.

1b03381.description: This script detects names which are not within zones considered to be local but resolving to addresses considered local.

a2cf3b1.description: If an RDP session is “upgraded” to SSL, this will be indicated with this script in a new field added to the RDP log.

9363b9a.description: Extracts SSH client and server information from SSH connections and forwards it to the software framework.

8049148.description: Software identification and extraction for DHCP traffic.

8c7bc4e.description: Detect and log web applications through the software framework.

baaccfa.description: Software identification and extraction for HTTP traffic.

5a02d33.description: Detect browser plugins as they leak through requests to Omniture advertising servers.

ba9197e.description: Watch for various SPAM blocklist URLs in SMTP error messages.

67f08c7.description: This script feeds software detected through email into the software framework. Mail clients and webmail interfaces are the only thing currently detected.

7cfebb3.description: Perform validation of Signed Certificate Timestamps, as used for Certificate Transparency. See RFC6962 for more details.

39d6c7e.description: Perform validation of stapled OCSP responses.

4b3ac05.description: Detect file downloads that have hash values matching files in Team Cymru’s Malware Hash Registry

5576da3.description: Software identification and extraction for MySQL traffic.

ba6557d.description: Generate notices when SSL/TLS connections use certificates, DH parameters, or cipher suites that are deemed to be insecure.

e202e1e.description: This script will generate a notice if an apparent SSH login originates or heads to a host with a reverse hostname that looks suspicious.

99e00b3.description: Detect hosts which are doing password guessing attacks and/or password bruteforcing over SSH.

b156bba.description: FTP brute-forcing detector, triggering when too many rejected usernames or failed passwords have occurred from a single address.

0fd1658.description: Loading this script extends the Notice::ACTION_EMAIL action by appending to the email the hostnames associated with Notice::Info’s src and dst fields as determined by a DNS lookup.

0727dc2.description: SQL injection attack detection over the HTTP protocol.

07dab12.description: Generate notices when X.509 certificates over SSL/TLS are expired or going to expire soon based on the date and time values stored within the certificate.
